abstract.text: Creates a time interval gauge, letting you specify whether the gauge fills or empties as time passes.

inlineContent.text: On watchOS 9.0 or later, use WidgetKit instead

A newly instantiated time interval gauge provider.
The gauge shows the amount of time that has elapsed, based on the current time relative to the specified start and end dates. You can specify whether the gauge counts up or counts down using the
and
parameters.
If the
is less than the
, the gauge fills as it counts up from the start time to the end time.
If the
is greater than the
, the gauge empties as it counts down from the start time to the end time.
On circular gauges, the fill fractions also determine the position of the start and end points along the circle.
indicates the top of the circle. Values increase as you move around the circle clockwise, with
back at the top again.
On corner gauges, you should always use the
and
as your fractional values, to ensure that you’re utilizing the whole gauge.
If you provide both colors and locations, then the
and
arrays must be the same length.

abstract.text: Display app-specific data on the clock face.
A gauge that tracks time intervals.
Creates a time interval gauge that fills as time passes.
Creates a time interval gauge, letting you specify whether the gauge fills or empties as time passes.
A representation of a specific point in time, for use when you need reference semantics or other Foundation-specific behavior.
An object wrapper for primitive scalar numeric values.
An object that stores color data and sometimes opacity.
A specific point in time, independent of any calendar or time zone.
